featured.title: Armenian Style Lentil Soup
featured.description: A hearty soup with lentils, mint, and parsley — a Shehirian family classic.
steps: Boil lentils in water for 15 minutes.
Add onion, parsley, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 45 minutes.
Add mint and butter. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Add 1/4 tsp. pepper and cook for 5 minutes.
Optional: Fry butter until light brown and pour over soup.

featured.title: Royal Soup
featured.description: A lemony meatball soup with rice and parsley, inspired by Middle Eastern flavors.
steps: Mix raw meat, bulghur wheat, onion, parsley and seasoning together and shape into 1" diameter balls.
Add rice to the meat balls mixture.
Add meat balls to hot chicken broth and simmer until cooked through.
Add lemon juice and celery. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add salt and lemon slices. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Adjust sourness, saltiness, or thickness with sugar, water, or rice as needed.
Pour broth over meatballs and serve.

featured.title: Scotch Broth with Bulgur Wheat
featured.description: A traditional Scottish soup transformed with hearty bulgur wheat and lamb.
steps: In a large pot, add lamb and water. Bring to a boil and skim off any foam.
Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour until lamb is tender.
Remove lamb, shred meat, and return to pot.
Add bulgur wheat, barley, carrots, turnip, and leeks.
Simmer for 45 minutes until grains and vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.

featured.title: Tabbouleh Salad
featured.description: A refreshing Middle Eastern salad with bulgur wheat, fresh vegetables, and herbs.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon finely chopped mint or 1/4 teaspoon dry mint
steps: Combine 2 cups boiling water and 1 cup bulgur wheat.
Let it stand until all water is absorbed, about 1 hour.
Combine in salad bowl with remaining ingredients.
Toss until dressing is well distributed.

featured.title: Bulgur Carrot Pineapple Salad
featured.description: A sweet and savory salad combining bulgur wheat with shredded carrots and tropical pineapple.
steps: Blend bulgur and pineapple juice.
Add carrots and pineapple.
Chill and mix well.
Serve in lettuce cups.

featured.title: Cole Slaw with Bulgur
featured.description: A hearty twist on classic coleslaw with the addition of nutritious bulgur wheat.
steps: Put 1/2 cup bulgur wheat in one cup of water, bring to boil, cover, reduce heat and simmer until water is absorbed, chill.
Blend all ingredients together.
Serve in lettuce cups and garnish with tomato wedges.

featured.title: Bulgur Carrot Raisin Salad
featured.description: A variation with raisins and French dressing for a delightful sweet and tangy flavor.
steps: Blend bulgur and French dressing.
Add carrots and raisins.
Chill and mix well.
Serve in lettuce cups.

featured.title: Chef's Bulgur Salad
featured.description: A hearty main course salad featuring bulgur wheat, fresh vegetables, and your choice of cold meats and cheese.
ingredients: 1/2 cup olive oil or salad oil
steps: Mix bulgur wheat, French dressing, pickle, salt and pepper.
Add green pepper, sliced celery and onion.
Mix well, serve on a bed of salad greens which have been tossed with French dressing.
Top with thin strips of cold boiled ham or tongue, cold chicken or turkey, and Canadian or Swiss cheese.

featured.title: Bulgur Dutch Cucumber Salad
featured.description: A creamy and refreshing salad with bulgur, cucumbers, radishes, and a tangy sour cream dressing.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon tarragon vinegar or lemon juice
steps: Combine cucumbers, pineapple, onions, and radishes in salad bowl with bulgur mixture.
In a separate bowl, mix sour cream, mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, salt, and white pepper.
Toss with the bulgur mixture and top with paprika.

featured.title: Bulgur Garden Salad
featured.description: A versatile garden salad with bulgur wheat, fresh vegetables, and hard-boiled eggs — perfect as a side or main dish.
steps: Mix bulgur wheat, French dressing, pickle, salt and pepper.
Add celery, bell pepper, eggs, and onion.
Blend in mayonnaise and mix well.
Serve on a bed of lettuce and garnish with tomato wedges.
For a hearty main course salad, add 1 can of tuna fish or some diced cooked meat or poultry.
